abstract_ssm: The Afghanistan Digital Library was a joint project of the New York University Libraries, the Department of Middle Eastern Studies, the Center for Near Eastern Studies, and the Center on International Cooperation, established in circa 2002. The website consists of digitized books, documents, and newspapers related to Afghani literature, poitics, economics, jurisprudence, the military, the government, and history from the 19th and 20th centuries.
corpname_ssm: Hagop Kevorkian Center for Near Eastern Studies
New York University. Department of Middle Eastern Studies

dao_ssm: Afghanistan Digital Library Archived Website: April 2018, April 2023
